HDG.BC.content: we have our residence in the distinction (Unterscheidung) btwn Being/beings [ontological difference] > ontological difference looks negative [isn’t], OD holds differentia apart (hält Unterscheidenes auseinander) [spacing], an extension & expanse, space of all spaces > at first, know nothing of this distinction, of what it consists remains hidden: in fact > whether code word (Kennwortes) “distinction” characterizes its essence remains undecided/unasked > “the distinction” more essential than all differences/oppositions btwn beings

HDG.FS.content: nothing in Heidegger not negative, is a nihilating nothing (nichtendes Nichts), its essence turns away from beings: “nothing in its nihilation refers to the being in its manifestation (Offenbarkeit),” “the nihilation (Nichten) of the nothing “is” being” [cf. 58 nihilating nothing as forgetfulness, beings pressing into foreground?]

HDG.FS.content: negative (Nichten) vs. denying (Verneinen): Greek distinction ouk and mē? > negating as Greek ouk, then nothing as total nothingness (nihil negativum): beings denied, there are no beings > negating via mē, certain defect re: being > but if being/nothing are same, nothing can’t signify a lack (Fehlen), negating not privative-negative, something other (etwas Anderes), completely specific/unique (ganz und gar Eigenes und Unvergleichliches)

HDG.WL.content: if to know means to see something in wholeness of its nature, we can’t see the nature of language as such, in the round, because we belong w/in Saying, can only say something by saying it after Saying > language is monologue [cf. MONL], has its structure in the Aufriss of Saying: 1) language alone speaks authentically 2) language speaks lonesomely (einsam) > the some in lonesome, the same, Greek hama, Gothic sama, thus lonesome: “same in what unites that which belongs together” > Saying is in need of being voiced in word [Being needs man] > man’s needed usage (Brauchen), his resaying (Nachsagen) of what he listens to, lies in that lack (Fehlen) that isn’t negative or defective

HDG.OHF.content: for faith, man is “fallen,” his being-fallen not derived from God, but state into which man brought himself [explanation of Kant-like co-givenness of man’s goodness & his possibility of falling] > primordial experience of being-sinful (Sündigseins) at particular time: closed context of experience, basis of anthropology of Christian theology > [Nietzsche-like] God-relation (as constitutive) neutralized into consciousness of norms/values, center of acts (archē), “Ego-pole”
